question: Which country houses the UNESCO World Heritage Site "Stari Most/Mostar Bridge"?
explanation: Stari Most, also known as Mostar Bridge, is located on Bosnia and Herzegovina. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is a bridge built by the Ottoman Empire in the 16th century crossing Neretva River. This bridge was destroyed in 1993 during the Croat-Bosnak War. In 2004, it was decided to rebuild it. It was constructed as per the Balkan Islamic Architecture. It was commissioned by Suleiman, the Magnificent in 1557.
